content.question: Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.) The work shown is Yinka Shonibare’s 2001 C.E. installation piece The Swing (after Fragonard). Describe at least two visual characteristics of The Swing (after Fragonard). Using at least two examples of specific evidence, explain how the work references or departs from different earlier artistic traditions. Using specific evidence, explain how Shonibare creates meaning in this work by referencing earlier artistic traditions.

topic.text: 10.2: Purpose and Audience in Global Contemporary Art

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Describe visual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. form.  b. style.  c. materials.  d. technique.  e. content.
